newsitem.title: CHINA: China cobalt powder venture says output rising.
newsitem.headline: China cobalt powder venture says output rising.

text.p: A joint venture between a Chinese-state firm and Belgian non-ferrous metals group Union Miniere SA is doubling production of cobalt powder every month, general manager Stephan Csoma said on Tuesday.
The Shanghai Blue Lotus Metals Co Ltd, a venture with a subsidiary of the China National Nonferrous Metals Industry Corp, began production at the end of April, Csoma told Reuters.
The plant's annual capacity exceeds 100 tonnes. Csoma, however, declined to give production figures but said output was rising fast.
"Every month, we are doubling production and increasing dramatically our sales volume," Csoma said.
The joint venture intended to dominate the market, he said. "(We intend) within a year or two to get 50 percent of the market and then we can control it," he said.
He said the venture so far faced no international competition in the Chinese market. "We intend to be big enough to scare them away," he said.
Union Miniere hoped to increase its investment within 1-1/2 years to expand production, Csoma said but gave no further details.
The total Chinese market for cobalt powder, which is used to make hard cutting edges, was estimated at around 500-800 tonnes. "We believe it is growing," Csoma said.
